member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX
member.summary: Contains extended memory statistics for a process.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.cb
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.PeakWorkingSetSize
member.summary: The peak working set size, in bytes.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.WorkingSetSize
member.summary: The current working set size, in bytes.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.QuotaPeakPagedPoolUsage
member.summary: The peak paged pool usage, in bytes.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.QuotaPagedPoolUsage
member.summary: The current paged pool usage, in bytes.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.QuotaPeakNonPagedPoolUsage
member.summary: The peak nonpaged pool usage, in bytes.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.QuotaNonPagedPoolUsage
member.summary: The current nonpaged pool usage, in bytes.

summary.para: The Commit Charge value in bytes for this process. Commit Charge is the total amount of private memory that the memory manager has committed for a running process.
Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2 and earlier: PagefileUsage is always zero. Check PrivateUsage instead.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.PeakPagefileUsage
member.summary: The peak value in bytes of the Commit Charge during the lifetime of this process.

member.name: PROCESS_MEMORY_COUNTERS_EX.PrivateUsage
member.summary: Same as PagefileUsage. The Commit Charge value in bytes for this process. Commit Charge is the total amount of private memory that the memory manager has committed for a running process.
